comment.text: This translation key is used for a notification message when a user is not found. The message will appear in a UI element displaying an error or exception related to a payer's information, likely on a SaaS payment settings page.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "غير موجود" (not found) is a literal translation but might sound unnatural in a user-facing message in Arabic. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of 'غير مسجل' (not registered) or 'غير موجود في النظام' (not found in the system).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'غير مسجل' or 'غير موجود في النظام' instead of 'غير موجود'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags `<1>` and `</1>` are the same as in the English content, which is generally acceptable, but could be reviewed for consistency with other translations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of formatting tags across all translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation includes a colon (:) at the end of the sentence. The English version does not. While not strictly incorrect, it alters the feel and should ideally match the original.

The Japanese translation includes the variable {{email}} within HTML tags <1> and </1>, mirroring the English format. While technically correct, this might be unnecessary and affect readability for Japanese users. It's better to remove the tags or use a standard format depending on the platform’s needs.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ユーザー {{email}} は見つかりません。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The email placeholder {{email}} is correctly placed within the Korean translation, mirroring the English version.
While generally correct, the phrasing "찾지 못했습니다" (chajji mothaesseumnida) is a bit formal for a user-facing error message. A more natural and user-friendly alternative might be preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more conversational phrase like "을(를) 찾을 수 없습니다" (eul(reul) chajeul su eopseumnida) or "찾을 수 없습니다" (chajeul su eopseumnida).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'O <1>{{email}}</1> do utilizador não foi encontrado.' is not the most natural or accurate translation. 'Utilizador' means 'user' and saying 'of the user' is redundant. A more accurate and natural translation would focus on the email address not belonging to a found user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O endereço de email <1>{{email}}</1> não foi encontrado.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are maintained in the Portuguese translation. While they are placeholders, maintaining them might not be necessary and may not be standard in the target locale.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the angle brackets if they are simply placeholders and not functional in the target system.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'පරිශ්‍රීලකයා හමු නොවිණි' is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala for a user-facing message. It sounds overly formal and technical. A more natural translation would convey that the user was not found.

The translation "<1>{{email}}</1> kullanıcısı bulunamad." is not the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'User <1>{{email}}</1> is not found.' A more natural phrasing would be '{{email}} kullanıcısı bulunamad.' or '{{email}} e-posta adresine sahip kullanıcı bulunamad.'

The original format uses `<1>` and `</1>`. The Turkish translation also uses `<1>` and `</1>`, but it's not consistently applied. While maintaining the original format may be required, it's worth considering whether it's necessary or if a simpler format would be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider simplifying the format to match the original.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Không tìm thấy người dùng<1>{{email}}</1>." is a literal translation but sounds unnatural in Vietnamese. A more natural phrasing would be 'Không tìm thấy người dùng với email <1>{{email}}</1>' or 'Không tìm thấy người dùng có email <1>{{email}}</1>'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Không tìm thấy người dùng với email <1>{{email}}</1>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> seem to be misplaced. It's unclear what their purpose is and they disrupt the flow of the sentence in Vietnamese.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags or ensure they are correctly used according to their intended purpose. If the intent is to highlight 'email', consider a more appropriate styling method.
